node.statement: Without loss of generality, we may assume gcd(p, q) = 1, i.e., p and q are coprime. If they share a common factor d > 1, we can divide both by d to obtain an equivalent representation p/d and q/d. By 'gcd-exists', every pair of integers has a well-defined greatest common divisor, so we can always reduce to this coprime form.
